top_categories.workout_context: 57ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 131, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At WYO 131, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
7,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Race-pace efforts that mimic WYO 131's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of WYO 131. Train it until it feels boring.
WYO 131's Mountain gravel, High desert forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 131 miles.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 131 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
7,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 7,500ft of climbing on Wyoming mountain and high desert gravel does to your power file on race day.
131 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Low-cadence force work for 7,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for WYO 131’s 131 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: WYO 131 with 7,500ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (6000-8000+ feet).
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at WYO 131 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on wyoming mountain and high desert gravel to build confidence. Expect: mountain gravel, high desert, wyoming wilderness.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Durability, and Over Under to prepare you for 131 miles of wyoming mountain and high desert gravel in Lander, Wyoming.
